intro: Bistorta griffithii, commonly known as the Griffith's bistort, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and flowering structures. The plant features upright, hairy stems that bear alternate, lance-shaped leaves with prominent veins. Its flowers are small, clustered in dense, cylindrical inflorescences, typically blooming in shades of pink or red. Bistorta griffithii is often found in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions.
